関連科目: Courses on geopolitics, international law, diplomacy of certain countries or regions, global studies
授業の概要・背景:
General introductions, definitions
IR theories
History of IR - from the World Wars, though the Cold War period and post-Cold War unipolar world to today's Multipolarism
Case studies
Analysis of past and present IR events
授業方法: This course will be conducted as a mix of lecture and interaction (seminar/discussion) format. Typically, the topics of each session will be introduced in lecture format (30-40 minutes) and further developed through Q&A/discussions and group work by the students.  Every session kicks off with a review of the latest international relations events based on the students’ following at least two news media (newspaper/online media).

トピック.授業計画1:
Typically, the sessions' topic will be introduced by the course lecturer in a 30-40 minute presentation followed by Q&A, discussions and group work (ex-prompt assignments in class or based on assigned homework/reading).
At the beginning of each day, we will look at the previous day’s main international news. This requires the students to look up the news every day in print- or online media.
